title: 103_hr4243
content: The Act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Building Heights Act of 1994" and imposes limitations on the height of buildings in the District of Columbia. The Act regulates building heights in the District of Columbia based on street width and limits the size and height of roof structures not used for human occupancy. The Act in the District of Columbia allows for taller roof structures not used for human occupancy if approved by the Mayor, with the condition that they are fireproof and set back from building walls. The Mayor can waive this requirement if it is deemed overly restrictive or impractical.
